primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God provides 'times of refreshing' (respite/breathing space) to weary pilgrims through the Resurrection and the Holy Spirit, sustaining them until the final Kingdom.

subject.identificatie: God / The Holy Spirit / The Risen Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord will give us 'times of refreshing'
the Holy Spirit descended upon the church
God intends also to use you
He will cool us with springs of living water
living water welling up to eternal life
promised gift of Jesus' own Holy Spirit, proceeding from the Father and the Son

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The 'feebler sort' / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: refreshed her along the weary way

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / Liturgical Rhythms / Acts of Kindness
tekstueel_bewijs: liturgical rhythm of the church... to draw us into the one permanent thing

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Stress, Sin, and the 'Mist and Darkness' of life
tekstueel_bewijs: tension, depression, strife, and unspoken pain
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but the ontological weight of death and the 'cruelty' of ephemeral life (Eliot/Frost references).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer, having been refreshed, acts as a sign of refreshment for others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (as servant of Christ)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical program is explicitly framed as a consequence of the primary soteriological program ('Because... Easter is not over').

voorbeelden_mens_subject: You can take some of this Easter joy
We may not stop to look at flowering trees

voorbeelden: you want to abide in Jesus' love

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Dunamis) of the Resurrection that enables the church, rather than the 'Duty' of the believer.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from Ephemeral Relief (~S1) to the reality of Death (S2), then through the denial of need (~S2) to the Eternal Refreshment (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the Resurrection of Christ which is 'the one gold thing that will stay.'
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon acknowledges that 'tea just won't do it' for deep grief.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently positions God as the primary actor and the Resurrection as the source of agency. Human action is presented as a 'random act' flowing from the Spirit's breeze.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of verbs of power
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the Spirit is doing it, not you
power of God... proven greater than the power of death

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Peter and the apostles are not models of effort, but recipients of 're-creation' and 'power from on high'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Peter is 'restored and recreated' by God.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and comfort; reduction of performance anxiety.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace in the primary program.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Great Fifty Days' (Soteriology) to 'Random acts of kindness' (Ethics) is logically and theologically integrated.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'quaint' sound of refreshment and the 'cosmic' reality of the Resurrection.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the power of God in Jesus had proven greater than the power of death

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit gives 'speech' and 'power' that is not human.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to the 'Mist and Darkness' and the inability to breathe.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a robust theocentric narrative where God is the Subject of the primary action (Refreshing) and the Hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The move from 'Stressed out' (lack of power) to 'Spirit-led' (endowment of power) is excellent.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject while addressing deep human psychological and existential needs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the 'refreshment' metaphor, semiotics reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the transfer of Power from God to a helpless Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek word 'anapsyxis'; semiotics shows how that word functions as the 'Object' of value in the narrative economy.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model highlights that the 'random acts of kindness' are not the main story, but a secondary program powered by the first.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Fleming Rutledge's own principles of 'God as Subject' effectively.
